creator: randofo
title: Printing Magnets with the Roland SP-540V
materials_required: Thin magnet sheeting (at least 1' wide by 2' long)
description: This project demonstrates how to print magnets using the Roland SP-540V large format printer. It involves preparing an image, loading the magnet sheet into the printer, configuring the software, printing, and then cutting the magnets.
steps: Prepare your images using Photoshop, Illustrator or Gimp with a resolution of at least 300 dpi, spacing out the magnets as closely as possible.
Save your final print file as a TIFF (or EPS if using Illustrator).
Load the magnet sheeting into the back of the printer, ensuring the rollers are positioned correctly under the silver markings and aligned with the scoring troughs.
Lower the rollers onto the print media using the handle on the front left-hand side of the printer.
Turn on the printer and allow it to position the print media, then use the back arrow to move the sheeting close to the rollers.
Open Roland VersaWorks and add your prepared TIFF (or EPS) file to Queue A.

Double click the file in the queue and configure the settings: Under "Layout," ensure the image fits within the usable print space. Under "Quality," select "Matte Calendared Vinyl (MCVP)" and "Standard." Under "Printer Controls," deselect "Cut Sheet after Output."
Rip the image by selecting the gear icon, then print it by selecting the icon that looks like an upside down 'A' in a microwave.
Once the magnets are printed, use a straight edge and razor blade to score and slice them into individual magnets.
Stick the magnets to any magnetic surface.
